metadata.title: CVE-2020-29668 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
Sympa before 6.2.59b.2 allows remote attackers to obtain full SOAP API access by sending any arbitrary string (except one from an expired cookie) as the cookie value to authenticateAndRun.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-29668` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

sympa - 6.2.58~dfsg-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sympa package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.58~dfsg-2').
